column107: Special Notes

For all Agricultural Districts Chapter 205 includes the following statement "including clusters of single-family farm dwellings permitted within agricultural parks developed by the State." All dwellings, including the primary dwelling, must be occupied by people who will operate the agricultural enterprise.

Setbacks, minimum individual lot sizes, etc are not specified in a project district. In the APD, there's a density guideline, but it's up to the interpretation of the project by the board. The intent is a master-planned, singularly owned sub-jurisdiction that offers a transition between developed communities and agricultural land
